identified-content.classifier: Top/News/U.S./U.S. States, Territories and Possessions/New York
Top/News/Sports/Pro Basketball/National Basketball Association/New Jersey Nets

abstract.p: New Jersey Nets basketball player Stephon Marbury is robbed of 24-inch diamond necklace worth $150,000 as he sits in car in Manhattan (S)

block.p: The Nets star Stephon Marbury was robbed of a 24-inch diamond necklace worth $150,000 as he sat in a car in Manhattan early yesterday morning, the police said.

Marbury told the police that he and a friend had just left a Manhattan nightclub and gotten into a Bentley parked on West 21st Street near 10th Avenue, when two men approached from either side of the car.
The Nets star Stephon Marbury was robbed of a 24-inch diamond necklace worth $150,000 as he sat in a car in Manhattan early yesterday morning, the police said.

Marbury told the police that he and a friend had just left a Manhattan nightclub and gotten into a Bentley parked on West 21st Street near 10th Avenue, when two men approached from either side of the car.
One of the men reached through an open passenger side window, where Marbury was sitting, and grabbed the necklace, the police said.
The men, who did not display a weapon, then got into a nearby car and drove off, Marbury told the police.
The robbery occurred about 3:45 a.m., the police said, as Marbury left Aria, a club on West 21st Street between 10th and 11th avenues.
A spokesman for the Nets, Gary Sussman, said the team would have no comment ''until we get further details.''
